title: Complaint Daily Mail Fake News on 1-1-2020 HK Protest

replies.msg:
The Daily Mail News published the story on 1 Jan 2020 stated that HK Protesters hurl Molotov Cocktails first, then Police use water cannons and teargas. But the truth is the undercover cops arrest and beat up protesters first, then the riot police fire teargas. Also nobody can confirm they were protesters or undercover cops hurl Molotov Cocktail. The article is misleading and imply protesters started the violent and caused the protest to stop.
The News Title: : Violence erupts at New Year's Day Hong Kong pro-democracy march joined by a MILLION people as masked protesters hurl Molotov cocktails before police use water cannons and tear gas
This is the link to the full article:
https://www.dailymail.co.uk/news/article-7842265/Thousands-march-Hong-Kong-New-Years-Day-pledge-fighting.html
This article will damage the International support we are fighting for, so we have to complain to the email below and ask them to correct.
corrections@mailonline.co.uk
